settings.title: COMMON QUESTIONS.
Where can I find updates on my order?
settings.answer: To find updates on your order visit our Order Status Menu.

settings.title: What are your order lead times?
settings.answer: Please allow 3-7 business days for us to thoughtfully package your ready-made wicks and supplies order. For custom products, please allow 1-3 weeks for us to create and package them, prior to shipping. Any order with a value of $1,000 or more will be processed in 7-10 business days. These order lead times do not include shipping times. Please refer to your chosen shipping method for approximate shipping rates.

settings.title: How do I qualify for Free Shipping?
settings.answer: All US orders over $99 qualify for free shipping. Please select the Free Shipping option when selecting your shipping method at checkout. Please note that some coupons and special offers cannot be combined with free shipping.

settings.title: What should I do if my package says delivered, but I have not received it?
settings.answer:
We highly recommend purchasing Route Protection for a worry-free delivery. If your package is delivered and you are unable to locate it, please contact your family members and neighbors first as they often end up in familiar hands. If you are still unable to locate your package after 5 days, please contact your shipping provider and file a lost package claim. Additionally, if they are unable to recover your package and you have not purchased Route Package Protection, please reach out to Customer Service with your claim number.

If you have claimed more than two packages as lost or stolen, it is your responsibility to place a new order for the product.

settings.title: Can products be ingested?
settings.answer: No, none of the products we sell should be ingested.

settings.title: Why did I get charged tax on my order?
settings.answer: Taxes are charged by the state for which you are delivering to. Tax rates vary from state to state. If you have a reseller certificate, please submit that to us HERE including the order number(s) you are seeking tax reimbursement for as well as the email address associated with your account so we can mark your account as a Reseller to remove tax on future orders.

settings.title: How do I contact Customer Service?
settings.answer: You can contact us by submitting an inquiry HERE or via Live Chat Monday-Sunday from 6 am - 5 pm PST. If you contact us outside of operating hours, please allow up to 72 hours to receive a reply.

settings.title: WHY MAKESY.
What are the benefits of using wooden wicks?
settings.answer:
Wooden wicks achieve a fast melt pool formation for quick and excellent hot throw.

Wooden wicks produce a tantalizing crackling sound when burning.

Wooden wicks have no mushrooming with little carbon buildup, debris or sooting.

Wooden wicks are rigid and require no straightening.

Wooden wicks can be used in all candle wax types.

Wooden wicks are applicable to container, pillar, and votive candles.

Our wicks are sourced and manufactured in the USA from fsc-certified mills.

There are multiple options to choose from for optimal performance and visual aesthetic.

Our wooden wicks can be customized to meet your needs.

settings.title: What makes wooden wicks unique?
settings.answer: Candle making has evolved from an ancient art born of necessity to a modern day luxury. Today, candle makers know that finding new ways to attract customers attention and stand out in a crowded marketplace of highly creative artisans is an ongoing marketing journey. That's why we love wooden wicks! A truly unique and engaging candle is created using wooden wicks… with a modern appeal, an intriguing visual aesthetic, and an enticing soft crackling sound. Makesy currently sells to DIY candle makers, national brands and manufacturers in over 70 countries around the world!

settings.title: Why Makesy?
settings.answer: Makesy is the exclusive licensed distributor of the wooden wicks, developed by the creator of the original wooden wick, Lumetique, Inc. As our customer, your wicks are protected under dozens of International patents. Makesy has a quick turnaround time, consistency in high quality product and service, and we offer an extensive product line with unlimited customization options. Not only that, but when you purchase our wooden wicks, we plant a tree and you help improve the living conditions of families in other countries.

settings.title: Why use a wooden wick instead of a cotton wick?
settings.answer: Wooden wicks can be customized to have a more unique visual effect and design. Wooden wicks create a unique horizontal flame.In larger diameter candles, wooden wicks can produce a full melt pool with only one wick eliminating the need to use multiple wicks (in most cases). Wooden wicks create an alluring crackling sound when burning for added ambiance. Being rigid, wooden wicks are very easy to use, saving time and money in production. There is no need to secure to a wick bar or dowels and no straightening is needed as there is with cotton wicks, which require a great deal of time to set up. Wooden wicks do not mushroom, have little to no carbon build-up, no debris and no sooting like cotton wicks. Wooden wicks are completely American made, being sourced and manufactured in the USA from the Forest Stewardship Council. There are multiple options available for optimal performance as well as visual aesthetic when using wooden wicks compared to cotton wicks. Wooden wicks provide a modern, unique and more upscale look to enhance a candle's value.

settings.title: Is it difficult to make a candle with a wooden wick?
settings.answer:
Making candles with wooden wicks isn't that different from making candles with cotton wicks. In fact, it's actually a little easier and less time consuming as there's no need to straighten or secure the wick with wick bars, dowels or sticks.We suggest following this simple guide:

Determine your wick size using our sample kit and wick selection guide. Secure your wooden wick into the wick clip. Secure the wick clip to the bottom center of your vessel with a wick sticker. Heat your wax to the specified temperature for your wax type. Add your candle scent and dye, if any, to the melted wax in the pouring pitcher (fragrance level and dye have a direct impact on the burn of a candle and you will need to experiment with different levels to achieve optimum performance). Gently pour the wax into the vessel, leaving 1/8″ - 3/16″ / 3.2Mm - 4.8Mm of the wick exposed. If the wick is longer you can trim it to this height after the wax has set. After the candle has cooled: if the surface is uneven or has imperfections, you can carefully use a heat gun to even it out. Be very careful not to burn the wick, this is a quick process of gently waving the heat gun a few inches above the surface to quickly melt it.Once the candle has set, trim the wick to 1/8″ - 3/16″ / 3.2mm - 4.8mm.

settings.title: What makes wooden wicks unique?
settings.answer: Candle making has evolved from an ancient art born of necessity to a modern day luxury. Today, candle makers know that finding new ways to attract customers attention and stand out in a crowded marketplace of highly creative artisans is an ongoing marketing journey. That's why we love wooden wicks! A truly unique and engaging candle is created using wooden wicks… with a modern appeal, an intriguing visual aesthetic, and an enticing soft crackling sound. Makesy currently sells to DIY candle makers, national brands and manufacturers in over 70 countries around the world!

settings.title: What are the benefits of using wooden wicks?
settings.answer: Wooden wicks achieve a fast melt pool formation for quick and excellent hot throw. Wooden wicks produce a tantalizing crackling sound when burning. Wooden wicks have no mushrooming with little carbon buildup, debris or wooden wicks are rigid and require no straightening. Wooden wicks can be used in all candle wax types. Wooden wicks are applicable to container, pillar, and votive candles. Our wicks are sourced and manufactured in the USA from FSC-certified mills. There are multiple options to choose from for optimal performance and visual aesthetic.

settings.title: SHIPPING + RETURNS.
What shipping methods ship with expedited order processing?
settings.answer: Both FedEx Overnight and FedEx 2 Day will receive expedited order processing. Orders shipped with these methods will be fulfilled within 1-3 business days from purchase. During peak or holiday seasons, this may be increased to up to 5 business days due to high demand. All other methods will process in 3-7 business days or otherwise noted on the product page.

settings.title: Why hasn't my package moved?
settings.answer: Please note that FedEx and USPS do NOT scan in packages at our facility. They pick them up in large trailers and on pallets and scan them at their hubs. If there are no scans for 1-2 days, the package has already left our facility (excluding weekends). The carriers are extremely overwhelmed right now so please allow more time for the package to be scanned in. If there is no movement for 3 days on a package, we are happy to send a replacement.

settings.title: What should I do if my package says delivered, but I have not received it?
settings.answer:
We highly recommend purchasing Route Protection for a worry-free delivery. If your package is delivered and you are unable to locate it, please contact your family members and neighbors first as they often end up in familiar hands. If you are still unable to locate your package after 5 days, please contact your shipping provider and file a lost package claim. Additionally, if they are unable to recover your package and you have not purchased Route Package Protection, please reach out to Customer Service with your claim number.

If you have claimed more than two packages as lost or stolen, it is your responsibility to place a new order for the product.

settings.title: What are your order lead times?
settings.answer: Please allow 3-7 business days for us to thoughtfully package your ready-made wicks and supplies order. For custom products, please allow 1-3 weeks for us to create and package them, prior to shipping. Any order with a value of $1,000 or more will be processed in 7-10 business days. These order lead times do not include shipping times. Please refer to your chosen shipping method for approximate shipping rates.

settings.title: Where are my items shipping from?
settings.answer: We are now shipping from two locations! Orders may ship in separate packages from our IL and CA locations.

settings.title: Why does my package say it has shipped but hasn't left the warehouse?
settings.answer: Your tracking information is created when your label has been generated. Once a label has been generated, it can take up to 24 hours for the tracking data to update on the shipping server.

settings.title: Where is my package?
settings.answer: After your order has been placed, you can expect ready-made wicks and all other supplies to ship within 3-7 business days. Custom Wicks can take from 1-3 weeks. Once your order has shipped, you will receive a confirmation and tracking number via email. Many orders ship in multiple packages. If you receive only part of your order, please allow an additional 1-2 business days for the remainder of your order to ship.

settings.title: What shipping methods ship with expedited order processing?
settings.answer: Both FedEx Overnight and FedEx 2 Day will receive expedited order processing. Orders shipped with these methods will be fulfilled within 1-3 business days from purchase. During peak or holiday seasons, this may be increased to up to 5 business days due to high demand. All other methods will process in 3-7 business days or otherwise noted on the product page. Wick orders sent to CA do not ship within this time frame

settings.title: Do you ship Internationally?
settings.answer: We do! If you are an International customer, USPS does not provide tracking for packages once they leave the United States. We are unable to give you any further information beyond what the tracking shows. To track packages for the entirety of their journey, we recommend selecting FedEx International Priority for all International orders.

settings.title: If I am an International customer, am I responsible to pay for duties and customs fees?
settings.answer: Yes. The payment of duties or customs fees is the responsibility of the consumer and will not be compensated through the Wooden Wick Co. Please be mindful of any customs or duties expected for import into your country of origin.

settings.title: New Russian Import Laws 2020
settings.answer: Effective as of February 2020, Russia will no longer be allowing personal packages to be imported into the country. If you are shipping to Russia, please address your order to a business address and include your business name to ensure delivery. We also recommend shipping via FedEx International Priority to ensure you are able to track your order across US borders.

settings.title: Do you accept Returns?
settings.answer:
Please note the following information regarding our Return + Exchange policies:

Fragrances: Fragrances are not eligible for return or exchange. If you are buying a fragrance for the first time, please refer to our Fragrance Discovery Kits or 10 ML sample sizes prior to purchasing a large amount of fragrance. In the event that you do end up with a large amount of fragrance you will not use, there are many Destash groups available and they are a great place to resell or trade your fragrances.

Wicks: Wicks are not eligible for return or exchange. Because we cannot guarantee the performance of any particular wick in your candle project, please refer to our Wick Selection Guide for guidance and purchase a Wick Sample Kit to conduct a burn test prior to purchasing a large number of wicks.

Vessels: Vessels are not eligible for return or exchange. Please purchase only 1 or 2 samples of new vessels to try out before purchasing a large number.

All Other Products: We do not accept returns or exchanges.

Our Promise: We always ensure customer satisfaction. If you have received a damaged or incorrect item, please reach out to us within 30 days of receipt and we will happily refund or replace the item as quickly as possible. If you have any questions or concerns regarding a product you purchased, please reach out to our Customer Experience Team who will happily assist you in finding a solution that meets your needs.

settings.title: What shipping carriers do you use?
settings.answer: We use all major carriers, and local courier partners. You ll be asked to select a delivery method during checkout.

settings.title: What if I received a damaged or incorrect item?
settings.answer: Our Promise: We always ensure customer satisfaction. If you have received a damaged or incorrect item, please reach out to us within 30 days of receipt and we will happily refund or replace the item as quickly as possible. If you have any questions or concerns regarding a product you purchased, please reach out to our Customer Experience Team who will happily assist you in finding a solution that meets your needs.

settings.title: ROUTE PROTECTION.
What is Route Package Protection?
settings.answer: Route covers against lost, damaged, or stolen orders. It's highly recommended you opt into the service at checkout. Orders under $100 USD will be charged .98 cents for the protection. Orders over $100 USD will be charged 2% of the orders total.

settings.title: How do I file a claim?
settings.answer: Go to the Route Resolve Center via the Route app or web link from your order confirmation email. Enter your order number and email address then select the reason for your claim. After selecting your claim reason, you will be asked to provide more details or photo proof. Once you provide more information you may select your preferred resolution.

settings.title: When will my claim be processed?
settings.answer: Claims will be reviewed for approval within 1-2 business days from filing.

settings.title: What happens after I file a claim?
settings.answer:
When the claim is approved you will either receive a refund or reshipment depending on the preferred resolution. 

If you opted for a reshipment you will receive a new order number and receipt. Once the order is fulfilled Route will send you another email with tracking information. All reshipments will continue to receive package protection.

If you opted for a refund you will receive the exact price you paid for the item. This excludes any shipping costs, taxes, discounts, or package protection.

settings.title: How long do I have to report an issue with Route?
settings.answer:
All issues must be reported within 60 days of the order date.

Ensure you report an issue within the respective deadlines:

- Damaged: Within 15 days of when the package was marked delivered

- Lost (domestic): Between 7* and 30 days from the last tracking update

- Lost (international): Between 20* and 30 days from the last tracking update

- Stolen: Between 5* and 15 days of when the package was marked delivered

settings.title: What should I do if my package says delivered, but I have not received it?
settings.answer: If your package is delivered and you are unable to locate it, please contact your family members and neighbors first as they often end up in familiar hands. If you are still unable to locate your package after 5 days, you will be required to file a police report if the order is over $100 USD. When filing, include an explanation that Route is a package protection company that is protecting your package against theft. Once filed, send Route the police report PDF through the claims dashboard.

settings.title: What should I do if my package was delivered to the wrong address?
settings.answer: If the wrong address was entered at checkout Route will not cover the replacement order.

settings.title: What should I do if my tracking has not been updated?
settings.answer: Please file a claim through the Route dashboard. Claims must be filed no sooner than 7 business days.

settings.title: AFTERPAY.
What is Installments with Afterpay?
settings.answer: Installments with Afterpay is a service that allows you to make purchases now and pay for them in four payments made every 2 weeks without any interest.

settings.title: Why are you offering Afterpay?
settings.answer: We believe in helping our Makers succeed and we see Afterpay as a solution for small businesses (like you!) to manage their cash flow. By having the option to pay for your supplies in four separate payments, you have more time to focus on making AND selling without having to spend so much at once.

settings.title: How do I use Installments with Afterpay?
settings.answer:
Simply shop online and add items to your shopping bag and checkout as normal. At the checkout choose Installments with Afterpay as your payment method. First-time customers will need to register with Afterpay and provide payment details, as usual, returning customers simply log in to make their purchase. It's that easy!

Please note that all items in your shopping bag must be eligible for Installments with Afterpay. A minimum purchase amount may apply and you must meet additional eligibility requirements to qualify.

settings.title: Can I use Installments with Afterpay if I'm an international customer?
settings.answer: Afterpay is only offered to our customers who have a US billing address, US shipping address, a US Visa or Mastercard (credit or debit card), or American Express and a US mobile phone number. Customers with international billing addresses, shipping addresses, and/or phone numbers will not be able to set up an account with Afterpay.

settings.title: How does the payment schedule work?
settings.answer:
All customers are required to make their first payment at the time of purchase, with the remaining three payments deducted every two weeks from your chosen payment method. If you choose to make additional payments before your scheduled pay dates, you may do so through your Afterpay account.

You can log in to your Afterpay account to view your payment schedule and make a payment before the due date if you choose to do so.

settings.title: Where can I find common questions about payments?
settings.answer: Check out the Afterpay Payments FAQ.

settings.title: When will my items be delivered if I use Installments with Afterpay?
settings.answer:
Afterpay orders are delivered as per our standard shipping time frame after you complete your order online.

Visit our shipping page for more information by clicking here.

settings.title: What if I can't pay an Afterpay installment?
settings.answer: If funds are not available or you otherwise do not make your payment when it is due, late fees may apply. Click here for complete terms.

settings.title: MAKERS TIPS.
Why don't my wicks work?
settings.answer: We want to provide you with the best experience possible, so we take customer satisfaction very seriously. Because candle making is a complex procedure with many extenuating factors, we can not guarantee how a wick will perform or crackle in your particular wax blend and vessel. Please begin with the Wick Sample Kit and perform all of the necessary testing to determine the best wick for your particular candle. Our YouTube Channel is an excellent resource to get you started.

settings.title: How do I conduct a Test Burn?
settings.answer: Trim the wick to 1/8″ – 3/16″ / 3.2Mm – 4.8Mm this is extremely important.Place candles on a heat-resistant surface in a safe, draft-free, undisturbed space with moderate ambient temperature.Light the candles and note the time. Do not leave candles unattended.After two hours observe the melt pool. At this point, the melt pool should have reached the full diameter of the candle. If it has not reached the edges, it's likely that the wick is too small or the wick was too long when lit.Record the details of the melt pool, the flame height, and any smoking or sooting. (We suggest taking a photo for easy reference.)After four hours, take note of the details once again and extinguish the candle. The melt pool should reach the edge of the vessel and be ½” / 12.7Mm deep. If the melt pool is deeper than ½” / 12.7Mm, or if the flame is too high, the vessel is too hot, or there is any sooting, the wick is too big.Let the candle cool completely for several hours and repeat the steps above. Before each lighting of the wooden wick, be sure to gently tap off any ash or burnt-top edge.

settings.title: Changes to our Wick Selections as of January 2020
settings.answer: As of January 2020, our ready-made wick heights are 3" and 5" for flat wicks; 5” for Spiral and 6” for Tube wicks. For additional height options, please select Custom Sized-Wicks.

settings.title: Are custom sizes available?
settings.answer: Yes. Please select Custom-Sized Wicks.

settings.title: What is the minimum quantity for customized wicks?
settings.answer: There is no minimum, however, a set up fee of $30 will be charged per order for quantities under 1,000. Delivery time will range between 1-3 weeks.

settings.title: What is the minimum quantity for ready-made wicks?
settings.answer: The minimum order quantity for our ready-made wick options is 100 pieces.

settings.title: Do you offer complimentary wick trimming?
settings.answer: Yes! Wick Trimming is available through our Custom-Sized Wicks selection. To have your wicks custom trimmed, please include your desired custom trim height in your order notes at checkout.

settings.title: What do I do if I can't find my desired wick size on the wick menu?
settings.answer: Please contact our Customer Service Team at Create@woodenwick.com and our experts will assist you in finding the perfect wick for your needs.

settings.title: THE PATENTS.
What are the common candle safety guidelines?
settings.answer: Never leave a burning candle unattended. Place candles on a stable, heat-resistant surface away from anything flammable. Do not burn candles in a draft. Keep candles out of reach of children and pets.

settings.title: Why do I need to sign a license agreement?
settings.answer: Makesy is a licensed distributor of wooden wicks developed by the creator of the Original Wooden Wick. Our patents cover wooden, semi-wooden or fibrous wicks exhibited in a planar, multi-layered, curved or varied shape wicks. Each wooden wick purchase on our website comes with a patent-protected license. The “click wrap” license is personal to the purchaser of the wicks and lasts until the completion or termination of the use of the wooden wicks (the specific wicks purchased on website). The license agreement gives customers the right/license to use the wooden wick technology and the terms of its use.

settings.title: How do I mark my products?
settings.answer: The best practice is to mark the candle product itself with the following patent marking: Pat. www.lumetique.com/patents We've created a pre-made warning label that includes the patent to make it easy for you. You can get them here.

settings.title: Why do I need to mark my products?
settings.answer: The purpose of the marking requirement is to meet our statutory obligations under 35 U.S.C. § 287. We must ensure that any and all licensees are marking their covered products, and providing constructive notice to the public that the product is patented. All candle products (whether a wooden wick, candle, box, hang-tag or other form of packaging) must be consistently and always marked as being covered by the applicable patents and patents pending.

settings.title: I was buying the same wood wicks from another supplier and I didn't have to mark. Why do I need to mark now?
settings.answer: While sometimes overlooked by businesses, compliance with the statutory requirements for patent marking is critical to companies (and their licensees) that hold one or more patents. The purpose of the marking requirement is to meet our statutory obligations under 35 U.S.C. § 287. We must ensure that any and all licensees are marking their covered products, and providing constructive notice to the public that the product is patented.

settings.title: Why do I need to provide my company name and the brand name of the candles I manufacture?
settings.answer: We request that you provide us with your company name and the brand name (if different than your company name) for each candle that you manufacture so that we know where our wooden wicks are being used in the marketplace; that you are protected under the licensing agreement; and, your candle products are not susceptible to patent infringement.

settings.title: DISTRIBUTOR DETAILS.
Do you offer wholesale prices?
settings.answer: All of our pricing is considered wholesale and volume discounts are already built into our pricing structure. However, we do offer bulk price breaks for various products. Any bulk discounts will automatically apply at the qualifying quantities and are available for reference under the “Bulk Discounts” tab on each product page that qualifies for bulk discounts.

settings.title: How do I become a distributor?
settings.answer: Distributors are required to sign a Distributor License Agreement with us that requires our distributors to disclose their customers to us bi-annually. If you are interested in becoming a distributor, please contact us HERE.

settings.title: Why do I have to disclose my customers if I am a Distributor?
settings.answer: We require that you provide us with the company name and/or the brand name (if different than the company name) of your customer so that we know where our wooden wicks are being used in the marketplace; that they are protected under the licensing agreement; and, their candle products are not susceptible to patent infringement.

settings.title: Do you have wholesale pricing?
settings.answer: All of our pricing is considered wholesale and volume discounts are already built into our pricing structure. Please see each product page under “Buy More and Save” for corresponding bulk price breaks.

settings.title: What qualifies for the bulk discount?
settings.answer: To receive bulk discounts, you will need to purchase a minimum quantity of one specific fragrance type or item variation. Multiple colors or fragrance types cannot be combined into the bulk discount MOQ.

settings.title: FRAGRANCE.
Which wax types will our fragrances work best in?
settings.answer: Our fragrances are a perfect match for all of our wax blends. They are also well suited to soy, soy blends, natural blends, coconut, paraffin, paraffin blends, palm and beeswax among others.

settings.title: Should I measure my fragrance in weight or volume?
settings.answer: Using weight as your measurement is the most accurate way to measure fragrance. To measure, tare your digital scale with your pouring device and weigh out your fragrance.

settings.title: Are your fragrances all natural and phthalate free?
settings.answer: While our candle fragrances are phthalate free and paraben free, high-end luxury fragrances of superior quality, they are not all 100% natural. The majority of our candle fragrances contain a combination of essential oils and fragrance oils that are formulated for optimum performance in a candle. However, we do have a line of 100% Natural Fragrances available as well!

settings.title: What is the difference between the Natural Collection of fragrances and the rest of your exclusive fragrances?
settings.answer: The Naturals Collection fragrances are made from natural materials extracted from natural chemicals and essential oils and are ISO 9235 certified. The rest of our exclusive fragrances are made using the highest quality fine fragrance oils + essential oils sourced from around the globe.

settings.title: Do you offer fragrance samples?
settings.answer: We offer a variety of Fragrance Discovery Kits as well as single 10 ML fragrance sizes for each fragrance to suit your sampling needs.

settings.title: Can I use the fragrances in soap or other body products?
settings.answer: Yes! All of our exclusive fragrances are approved for use in other products. You can find application percentages in the “More Details” section on each product page. IFRA and MSDS sheets are also available in this section.

settings.title: Where can I get EU Allergen documents for my fragrances?
settings.answer: EU Allergen documents are available for each fragrance upon request.

settings.title: Why is my fragrance bottle not filled all the way?
settings.answer: Fragrances are sold by weight, not volume. Often times, fragrances are not filled all the way because the fragrance molecules are dense, resulting in a weight that does not reflect the bottle's liquid fill.

settings.title: ESSENTIAL OILS.
Are your essential oils 100% pure?
settings.answer: Yes, all of The Wooden Wick Co. essential oils are 100% pure, undiluted, and made using the highest quality natural plant materials.

settings.title: Can I use essential oils in candles?
settings.answer: Yes! You can absolutely use essential oils in candle making. In fact, almost every fragrance oil we offer also contains natural essential oils. Essential oils, especially citrus, tend to have lower flash points than fragrance oils. You need to be aware of your essential oils flash point, so that you add the oil to your melted wax when the wax is lower than the essential oils flash point. We suggest adding 5-10 degrees F lower than the flash point. This ensures that your essential oil will not burn off, or degrade during the candle making process.

settings.title: Can essential oils go directly onto skin?
settings.answer: Some can, but others are only safe on the skin at lower percentages and need to be diluted in a carrier oil or base in order to be safe on the skin. Check “The Details” section on each individual essential oil product page for the skin safe percentages.

settings.title: What products can I make with essential oils?
settings.answer: The list is literally endless! Essential oils are incredible, concentrated ingredients that can be used in many home fragrance and personal care products such as: candles, soaps, diffusers, melts, room sprays, body sprays, perfume, bath bombs, body scrubs, body lotion, shampoo, conditioner, face and body oils, hand sanitizers, linen sprays, facial mists, and that is literally just a few! Essential oils are also used medically and internally around the world. Not all essential oils are 100% skin safe or safe to ingest, so check each product page in “The Details” section to be sure.

settings.title: Should I use less essential oil than fragrance oil since it is more concentrated?
settings.answer: If we're talking candle making (and we often are), then our recommended dosage for fragrance or essential oil is 8-12% by weight. We suggest starting by using the same % as suggested for fragrance oils, and then scaling up or down based on your desired performance and scent throw. When making your own products, there is often no “easy answer”... it's best to test things out, and if we're being honest, that's half the fun anyways! Some oils will be stronger than others, with fragrance or essential oils, and you may be able to decrease or need to increase your percentage based on your desired results.

settings.title: WAX.
What is the ratio of coconut to apricot or coconut to soy in the wax blends?
settings.answer: The formula details for the wax blends are proprietary and therefore not available.

settings.title: Do your wax blends contain paraffin?
settings.answer: Only our Virgin Coconut Soy and Coco Apricot Créme waxes contain a miniscule amount of highly refined food-grade paraffin. We add a small amount of food grade paraffin because we have found it to enhance the performance of our wax and give an excellent hot throw. Scientific studies have proven paraffin wax to burn just as cleanly as soy, beeswax, or palm. And the highly refined food-grade nature of our paraffin puts it in the natural category. Contact us to read the study.

settings.title: What is the difference between the Virgin Coconut Soy and the Coco Apricot Crème waxes?
settings.answer: The Coco Apricot Crème contains apricot and no soy. While soy is very popular in the current marketplace, there are some customers who prefer to stay away from it due to the many candle making difficulties associated with soy.

settings.title: Do you offer samples of the wax?
settings.answer: We offer a variety of wax discovery kits for sampling purposes.

settings.title: Can your waxes be used for massage candles?
settings.answer: All of our wax types are suitable to use in massage candles.

settings.title: WICKS.
What are your wood wicks made from and are they treated?
settings.answer: They are made from only 100% Natural wood from Sappy Fruit Trees sustainably sourced in the USA. Our adhered wicks are created using a vegan, non-toxic proprietary adhesive with wood species not listed in the CITED appendices or on the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. They are not treated.

settings.title: What is a Spiral Wick?
settings.answer: The Spiral Wick .01 is the newest addition to our unique Shaped Wicks Collection. Made from native sappy fruit trees, The Spiral Wick .01 offers a one of a kind cylinder shaped flame with a crackling range of 2-5.

settings.title: Do I need to treat the wicks with anything before using them?
settings.answer: No. Contrary to some of the information available about wood wicks in general, we do not recommend treating wooden wicks with anything before using them, in fact we advise against it.

settings.title: What waxes and vessel sizes work best with the Spiral Wick?
settings.answer: The Spiral Wick .01 performs best in natural wax blends and typically burns an approximate 3” to 3.5” / 7.6 cm to 8.9 cm melt pool. The Spiral Wick .01 can be used to provide a modern, upscale look to your candles.

settings.title: What wick clip do I use with the Spiral Wick?
settings.answer: The Spiral Wick Clip was specially designed to hold the Spiral Wick completely upright, ensuring an easy manufacturing process + safe burning performance. Simply slide the wick into the clip, add your wick sticker, and place it into the center of your vessel.

settings.title: What is the difference between the Tube and Spiral Wick?
settings.answer: Our Tube Wick is a cylindrical shaped wick that creates a 2-2.5” diameter melt pool. Our Spiral Wick is a cylindrical shaped wick that creates a 3-3.5” diameter melt pool. Both wicks are suitable for use in beeswax or natural wax blends with palm, coconut, or soy oils.

settings.title: THE SOAP SUPPLIES.
How do I make Melt + Pour soap?
settings.answer: We love melt and pour soap because it is extremely easy for beginners to use! In fact, it is a great activity to do with your kids or family as well. To make melt and pour soap, simply cut up your block of soap into small pieces, and microwave in spurts of 20-30 seconds until the soap has completely melted. From there, you can add your fragrance and any other fun ingredients like mica, dyes, and dried botanicals to customize your creations!

settings.title: Do your soaps contain lye?
settings.answer: Yes, in order to make soap, you must use lye. However, with melt and pour soap, the lye has already been added to the soap and gone through saponification. This means it is already cured and ready to use! When using melt and pour soap, you don't have to handle lye and can focus on the fun creative aspects of soap making.

settings.title: Do your soap bases lather?
settings.answer: Lathering, also known as the froth or bubbles that soap creates, is primarily caused by synthetic detergents or SLS in a soap base. However, 100% natural soap bases, like ours, can lather too! Soap naturally creates small bubbles when in contact with water. While you won't see as much lather as with synthetic soap ingredients, we far prefer the safety of using 100% natural soap. Our bases do not contain any SLS or synthetic detergents.

settings.title: Should I use a double boiler or microwave to melt the base?
settings.answer: Either method works! We personally prefer using the microwave as we find this to be the easiest way to melt your soap base, and avoid overheating, however both methods are totally acceptable.

settings.title: Can I add other oils or ingredients to your bases?
settings.answer: We do not suggest adding any other oils to our melt and pour bases. The beauty of melt and pour soap is that it is already a perfectly created, stable soap as is! Adding additional oils to your base will alter the hardness and performance of your soap. You can however add fragrance, micas, exfoliants, dried botanicals, and dyes to customize your soaps!

settings.title: How much fragrance should I use?
settings.answer: We suggest using 3-6% fragrance in your soaps. Be sure to check the fragrance product page: In the details section, you will find the maximum load you can use safely for soaps.

settings.title: How many bars of soap can I make from a single 1lb block?
settings.answer: The amount of bars you can create depends on the oz fill of each bar you plan to create. To determine how many bars you can make, first choose your mold, then determine the oz fill of the mold, and that will tell you how many bars can be created! For example, if your mold makes 3oz bars of soap, you can make at least 5 bars from a 1lb block.

settings.title: THE HAND SANITIZER, ROOM & BODY AND PERFUME SPRAY SUPPLIES.
Which base should I use?
settings.answer:
Our bases can be used to create so many different products, we could go on and on about them! However, we will stick to the most popular ones here. Organic + Wildcrafted Witch Hazel = Best for Room, Body, Linen, and Facial Spray. Organic Alcohol + Witch Hazel = Best for Hand Sanitizer, Surface Cleaner or Body Spray.

Organic Sugarcane Alcohol = Best for Hand Sanitizer, Surface Cleaner or Perfume.

settings.title: How do I make a hand sanitizer?
settings.answer: Easy peasy! Simply pick your bottles, pick your base (we suggest Organic Alcohol + Witch Hazel, and pick your fragrance. Combine base and fragrance, add to bottles, shake and spray! We suggest 3-6% fragrance load. You can use essential oils or fragrances, plus you can also add crystals for a little sparkle. Be sure to use at least 60%-95% alcohol when making hand sanitizer. This base contains 75% alcohol.

settings.title: How do I make a room spray, facial spray or linen spray?
settings.answer: Simple as can be. Simply pick your bottles, pick your base (we suggest Organic + Wildcrafted Witch Hazel, and pick your fragrance. Combine base and fragrance, add to bottles, shake and spray! We suggest 3-6% fragrance load. You can use essential oils or fragrances, plus you can also add crystals for a little sparkle.

settings.title: Is the Organic Sugarcane Alcohol Food Safe?
settings.answer: This alcohol has not been food safe certified and we would not recommend using it for tinctures or other internal applications.

settings.title: How do I make body spray?
settings.answer: Ready to smell amazing? Simply pick your bottles, pick your base (you can utilize EITHER Organic + Wildcrafted Witch Hazel or Organic Alcohol + Witch Hazel), and pick your fragrance. Combine base and fragrance, add to bottles, shake and spray! We suggest 3-6% fragrance load. You can use essential oils or fragrances, plus you can also add crystals for a little sparkle.

settings.title: How do I make perfume?
settings.answer: Making your own perfume is both fun and easy to do! Simply pick your bottles, pick your base Organic Sugarcane Alcohol and pick your fragrance. We suggest using one of our Luxury fragrance oils. If you aren't sure which one to use, our Luxe + Chic fragrance discovery kit is a great place to start. Combine alcohol and fragrance, add to bottles, and you've done it! We suggest using 20-25% fragrance load. You can use essential oils or fragrances, plus you can also add crystals for a little sparkle.

settings.title: Are your bases natural?
settings.answer: Yes, all of our spray bases are 100% natural, organic, and sustainably sourced. Why? Because you deserve it.

settings.title: How much fragrance should I use?
settings.answer: Our suggested fragrance loads are as follows. Remember fragrance % is always calculated by weighing the fragrance. For help, visit our Fragrance Percentage Chart. Hand Sanitizer, Room Spray, Body Spray, Linen Spray, Facial Spray, Surface Cleaner: 3-6%, Perfume: 20-25%.

settings.title: THE MAKERS SUPPLIES.
Is it necessary to use a wick sticker to make a candle?
settings.answer: While it isn't necessary per say, it sure does make things a lot easier! If you don't use a wick sticker, the wick will move about and you may end up with a candle with an off-center wick. As all of us candle makers know, an off center wick is no good. Additionally, as the candle burns near the bottom, the wick sticker helps to keep the wick assembly secure and in place when the wax is completely liquefied, ensuring the utmost safety to those burning the candle.

settings.title: How many candles can I make with a 5 lb slab of wax?
settings.answer: While 1 pound equals 16 ounces, there is information that says that one pound of wax equals 20 ounces by liquid volume. We tried that theory and found that did not quite work for us and we ran short of wax. We are going to stick with 1 pound of wax is equal to 16 oz of liquid wax; therefore, one 5 pound slab of wax equals roughly 80 oz of liquid wax. If you were making 10 oz candles, this would create 8 candles. If you were making 8 oz candles, this would create 10 candles.

settings.title: I need more vessels than you have available, can I get more?
settings.answer: It may be possible for us to acquire additional stock of the vessel of your choice. Please email us at support@makesy.com with the style and quantity required and one of our customer service representatives will be in touch with you as soon as possible.

settings.title: ENHANCERS.
How much Mica should I use in my candles?
settings.answer: After the wax has cooled, sprinkle the mica on top or gently smear it on top the wax. Or you can add an extremely small amount (Around 1/32 teaspoon for 8oz wax) to your melted wax and stir in with fragrance. We've found the best performance by adding to the top of the candle after it has cooled.

settings.title: Can I dye my wax with Mica?
settings.answer: Mica may also be stirred into the melted wax for a colored effect. Please note that adding Mica into your wax may influence your candle's burn performance. Please burn test prior to selling your candles when making any changes in color.

settings.title: How do I use crystals in my candles?
settings.answer: To decorate your candles using crystals, gently heat gun the surface of your candle after it has set to create a soft surface to place crystals into the softened wax on the top of your candle. Make sure to never place crystals close to the wick as it may fall on the wick or hinder burn performance.

settings.title: THE DIFFUSERS.
How much fragrance do I use for making a Reed Diffuser?
settings.answer: We recommend using no more than 25% fragrance when making your reed diffuser.

settings.title: Do you sell caps for your diffuser vessels?
settings.answer: No. We recommend pre-mixing your fragrance with your diffuser base and shipping it to customers in a bottle such as our Gloss White Bottle.

settings.title: Will the black diffuser reeds stain my diffuser base?
settings.answer: Because the black diffuser reeds contain a natural dye, some coloration is normal. If you are using a clear vessel for your diffuser we recommend using the Natural Reeds as they contain no pigment.

settings.title: Do your diffuser bases contain Phthalates?
settings.answer: No. Our diffuser bases are Paraben free, Vegan, Allergen free, Phthalate free, with No Prop 65 Ingredients.

settings.title: What's the difference between your Natural Diffuser Base and the Coco Vegan Diffuser Base?
settings.answer: Our Natural Diffuser Base is the only 100% Natural diffuser base on the market, formulated without chemicals or fragrance enhancing additives. Our Coco Vegan Diffuser Base is infused with natural coconut oil, but is not free of all chemicals.

settings.title: What are your diffuser reeds made from?
settings.answer: Our reeds are made from 100% natural rattan.

settings.title: ECO DYES.
How do I use Eco Dyes?
settings.answer: The recommended temperature for adding our Eco Dyes is 180 F / 85 C or cooler. Exposing the dyes to higher temperatures for prolonged periods of time may cause fading or color alteration. Color can vary based on your wax type, fragrance, and any other additives, so be sure to test and take notes to achieve your desired vibrancy.

settings.title: What waxes can I use with Eco Dyes?
settings.answer: Eco Dyes will work with virtually all wax blends. Certain wax types like Soy wax don't always hold dye as well, so if you have any issues reach out to your wax supplier for more information about using dyes with your wax type.

settings.title: Can I use Eco Dyes in other applications besides candles?
settings.answer: Our Eco Dyes are intended for candles and wax melts only. If skin exposure occurs, the dye may temporarily stain the skin.

settings.title: Do Eco Dyes have a smell?
settings.answer: Because of their concentration levels, the dyes have a slight odor to them that is undetectable when diluted into a finished product.

settings.title: How much Eco Dye should I use?
settings.answer: For the most dark and vibrant colors, we suggest using a 0.05% concentration. For lighter shades, we suggest a 0.005% concentration. If you are making in smaller batches, this translates to about 8 drops per pound of wax for dark colors and about 2 drops per pound for lighter shades.

settings.title: What does it mean that they are REACH registered?
settings.answer: All dyes in our Eco Dyes collection are REACH registered, which is a regulation designed to protect human and environmental health from chemicals that could cause harm to the people, planet or animals.

settings.title: Are Eco Dyes vegan?
settings.answer:
While not vegan, Eco Dyes are:

Free of Prop 65 Ingredients

Made with a Renewable Solvent System

Paraben and Phthalate Free

Made without Animal Cruelty

REACH Registered

settings.title: NATURAL POWDERS.
What applications can I use Natural Powders?
settings.answer: Natural Powders can be safely used in soap and body care products. We would not recommend using them with sprays, candles, or diffusers as they may clog spray bottles and reeds.

settings.title: Do I need to prepare the powder before use?
settings.answer: For soap or body care, we suggest mixing 1 teaspoon of powder with 1 tablespoon of alcohol prior to adding to soaps for best results.

settings.title: Will Natural Powders change the texture of my product?
settings.answer: Some powders may leave natural fibers on the surface of your soap, that appear as small colored spots, which add a more rustic and earthy look to the product. Make sure to test to see how a specific powder behaves in your product!

settings.title: Are Natural Powders vegan?
settings.answer: Yes! All of our Natural Powders are 100% Natural, vegan, and sustainable sources.

settings.title: How much Natural Powder should I use?
settings.answer: Like Micas, we recommend starting small with a tsp or two and gradually increasing until your desired color and consistency is reached. A little goes a long way!

settings.title: THE PERKS.
What are The Perks?
settings.answer: The Perks program is our way of showing how much we appreciate you! You can earn perks by referring friends, purchases, and much more. Perks can even be used to earn discounts toward purchases – that means the more you collect, the more you save!

settings.title: Who can join The Perks?
settings.answer: Anyone can join The Perks rewards program. Once you create an account, you will be automatically enrolled in the program. See Terms & Conditions for further details.

settings.title: How do I earn Perks points?
settings.answer: You'll earn points just for creating an account! After that, you can also earn points by following us on social media, making purchases, referring friends, and more. To see all the ways you can earn points, please refer to the table above.

settings.title: How do I redeem my points?
settings.answer: Select the “Get Vouchers” tab, located in The Perks section of your account. If you have enough points, you can claim them for a redeemable voucher. At this time only one voucher may be redeemed per order and cannot be combined with other discounts.

settings.title: What are redeemable vouchers?
settings.answer: A redeemable voucher is a discount code for an amount off your purchase. To redeem, these voucher codes should be applied in the “Promo Code” section during checkout. Vouchers may not be combined or used with some discount codes.

settings.title: Why do I only have one option for a voucher?
settings.answer: We want to reward our loyal Wooden Wick Co. shoppers. That's why we now have unique voucher options that get better with each reward tier!

settings.title: Is there a maximum amount of points that I can learn?
settings.answer: Nope, the sky's the limit! You can't cap creativity ;)

settings.title: Does my Perks tier ever change?
settings.answer: The Perks levels reset every 12 months from the date that the level was reached if you do not reach the required spend to maintain the threshold. For example, if you are at The Enthusiast ($250 threshold), and EARN that level on August 8th, you have until August 8th the following year to reach the qualified spend level amount ($250) again – or your tier will reset to the Enthusiast. When you move up a tier, that erases your previous “earn date” and replaces it with the new date when you reached the newest tier. You have 12 months to maintain that newly acquired tier.

settings.title: How do I get points for following on social media?
settings.answer: Simply log in to your account and go to the The Perks dashboard. Select the tab “Earn Points” and click on any of the social media outlets you wish to follow. Log in to that platform and “like” or follow us! If you already follow us, simply unfollow then follow again to get points for the action.

settings.title: What do the 'approved', 'pending' and 'cancelled' statuses mean?
settings.answer:
“Approved”: These points can immediately be redeemed for a discount voucher.

“Pending”: These points need to be verified before they can be redeemed. This typically applies to purchases, reviews, and referrals. The approval period is 14 business days.

“Cancelled”: These points will not be added to your total point balance. This will happen if you cancel a purchase; the points will accordingly change from “pending” to “cancelled”.

settings.title: Can I use my points during checkout?
settings.answer: Your points must first be redeemed for a discount voucher, which can then be applied to your purchase total during checkout.

settings.title: Who do I contact for questions about my Perks account?
settings.answer: Please contact us HERE if you have questions regarding tour Perks or to be disenrolled. Please note if you disenroll, any points accrued will be lost, and will no longer available should you decide to enroll again.

settings.title: If I wasn't logged in, how do I get my points for a purchase?
settings.answer: Send us your order number HERE and we're happy to get your points added. Points cannot be retroactively applied for any orders prior to September 1st, 2020.

settings.title: I accidentally redeemed a Voucher that I didn't use. What do I do?
settings.answer: Perk points are not refundable. Once a voucher is redeemed on your Perks dashboard, we cannot reverse it. It does not expire so if you missed using it on this order, you can save it and use it on another! In the event your order is cancelled and you redeemed a voucher on the purchase, the points for the voucher redemption will automatically return to your account.

settings.title: NEXT TOP MAKER FAQ.
When does the Next Top Maker 21 contest start?
settings.answer: Wednesday, March 31st, 2021

settings.title: When does the contest close and is the last day to submit my entry?
settings.answer: Friday, April 16th, 11:59PM PST 2021

settings.title: Where is the submission page?
settings.answer: https://woodenwick.com/NTM21

settings.title: Will the submission page save my fields?
settings.answer:
No. Submissions will not be saved and must be completed in the same session.

*we recommend creating your photos and videos and uploading them to your Instagram accounts so you will be ready to share your link to your post in the submission page*

settings.title: When will makesy announce the winner?
settings.answer: E-mail and social communications will go out during the entire process. We will host a free~virtual~event to celebrate the week of April 18th, 2021.

settings.title: What do I need to do to submit my entry?
settings.answer:
It's easy we'll ask you to provide:
● Personal contact info / social handle(s)
● Business name, product description + distribution info
● Reasons why you think you should be our Next Top Maker
● Create a photo or video of yourself making/sharing your story shared to your Instagram #NTM21

settings.title: How many times can I enter?
settings.answer:
Once. But...you can add bonus entries by following the prompt after you hit “submit”:
● Leave us a review on Trustpilot
● Follow The Wooden Wick Co. on Instagram (instagram.com/woodenwick)
● Subscribe to The Wooden Wick Co. on YouTube
● Join our Wooden Wick Facebook Group

settings.title: I live outside the United States, can I still enter?
settings.answer: The Next Top Maker contest is open to all U.S. + Canadian Residents.

settings.title: I'm stuck on my essay. What should I say?
settings.answer:
We really just want to get to know you & why you should be The Next Top Maker. Here are some ideasto get your creativity flowing!

What is your WHY?

What do you love about “making”?

How'd you get started?

Who do you inspire?

Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

Why would winning this change your life?

settings.title: What is the makesy looking for in my submission?
settings.answer: Creativity & your true-authentic self + story!

settings.title: What will I win?
settings.answer:
1. $5000 Small Business Grant + Wooden Wick Maker Supplies

$2500 in Wooden Wick store credit, $2500 in grant money.

2. 5 One-on-One Educational Consults tailored to your business needs

3. Year-long Maker-in-Residence Status with The Wooden Wick Co.

4. A Wooden Wick Spotlight

5. Premiere VIP Discounts

settings.title: Can makesy use my photo or videos?
settings.answer: Yes. Upon entering this contest, all entrants must consent to makesy using their story, brand, and success in public marketing efforts.

settings.title: What do I do once I've submitted my entry + entered all the bonus opportunities?
settings.answer: Hang tight, check out and encourage other submission posts by looking up the hashtag #NTM21

settings.title: How do I upload my photo or video?
settings.answer: Like a normal Instagram post. Be sure to include the hashtag #NTM21 so we can see it. You'll want to copy and paste the URL to your post and share it in the submission form.

settings.title: Does my Instagram account need to be public?
settings.answer: Yes. This is so we can see your photo or video submission.

A helpful guide to determine the
best wooden wick for your candle project. We are here for you every step of the way.

kit with a variety of different types
of wicks + clips to choose from for your project.
